0.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Projet de Developpement
            de L'elevage

abstracts.cdata!:
This is a project completion report of
            the Livestock Development Project in Burkina Faso. The
            project was the Bank's first livestock-related
            investment in Burkina. At the time of preparation,
            agriculture was the most important economic activity,
            employing between 80-90 percent of the population. Within
            this sector, livestock represents an important resource,
            providing approximately 10 percent of the Gross Domestic
            Product (GDP) and 50 percent of recorded exports. The great
            majority of the national herd is owned and managed by Fulani
            pastoralists. There is little integration of livestock into
            the farming systems and little use of modern production
            techniques. Traditional production rates are low, due to
            disease, poor pasture and herd management, low and erratic
            rainfall, and poor genetic potential. The aim of the project
            was to assist some 300,000 traditional cattle producers
            through a program of group ranch development, improved
            livestock marketing facilities, meat processing, and
            veterinary services.
